detail.title: Transmission
detail.copy: At the center of the Audi S5 is a 6-speed manual transmission that offers a seamless connection between car and driver to take advantage of the car's direct-response handling and aggressive driving dynamics.

detail.title: quattro® 40/60
detail.copy: The Audi S5 features the asymmetric, dynamic torque split principle, which optimizes road dynamics with a rear-biased 40/60 split. This puts more power toward the rear of the vehicle for optimized cornering and handling dynamics.

detail.title: Brakes
detail.copy: The high-performance braking system on the Audi S5 is engineered in size and capacity to match its aggressive performance characteristics. The result is optimal axle-load distribution to increase top rates of retardation across all speed ranges. Additionally, rear-axle kinematics are maximized to compensate for pitch and low body movement for sensitive braking control.

detail.title: Dual Branch Exhaust System
detail.copy: A dual-branch exhaust system with 4 oval tailpipes features an Audi S5-specific intake diameter and length to increase high-volumetric efficiency and resonate better at each RPM pulse.

detail.title: Wheels
detail.copy: 19" cast aluminum, 5-parallel spoke, 8.5 x 19 rims mated to 255/35 ZR19 tires enables greater road feel, maximizes the Audi S5's new suspension characteristics and accentuates its more aggressive stance.

detail.title: Powerplant
detail.copy: The Audi S5 experience begins with a powerful V8 FSI engine, which boldly produces 354hp and 325lb-ft of torque. Meticulous weight-distribution allows the aggressive design to take full advantage of the dynamic engine characteristics.

detail.title: Drivetrain
detail.copy: A lower-mounted steering rack is positioned ahead of the line of the front axle for better feel. Rear-biased, quattro® permanent all-wheel drive with asymmetrio/dynamic torque distribution, enables pinpoint handling no matter what the road throws at you. Add an S-tuned sport suspension with new five-link front suspension and the result is an expertly tamed Audi S5 with more direct steering and superior handling dynamics.
